summary: Select a subset of variants from a VCF file

arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Output called genotypes in final VCF (otherwise no-call)
arguments.name: --call-genotypes

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Output variants also called in this comparison track
arguments.name: --concordance
arguments.fulltext:
A site is considered concordant if (1) we are not looking for specific samples and there is a variant called
 in both the variant and concordance tracks or (2) every sample present in the variant track is present in the
 concordance track and they have the sample genotype call.

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: Output variants not called in this comparison track
arguments.name: --discordance
arguments.fulltext:
A site is considered discordant if there exists some sample in the variant track that has a non-reference
 genotype and either the site isn't present in this track, the sample isn't present in this track, or the
 sample is called reference in this track.

arguments.summary: Genotype annotations to drop from output vcf.  Annotations to be dropped are specified by their key.
arguments.name: --drop-genotype-annotation
arguments.fulltext: Genotype annotation fields to be dropped (specified by key)

arguments.summary: Info annotations to drop from output vcf.  Annotations to be dropped are specified by their key.
arguments.name: --drop-info-annotation
arguments.fulltext: Info annotation fields to be dropped (specified by key)

arguments.summary: Don't include filtered sites
arguments.name: --exclude-filtered
arguments.fulltext:
If this flag is enabled, sites that have been marked as filtered (i.e. have anything other than `.` or `PASS`
 in the FILTER field) will be excluded from the output.

arguments.summary: List of variant rsIDs to exclude
arguments.name: --exclude-ids
arguments.fulltext:
List of IDs (or a .list file containing ids) to exclude. The tool will exclude variants whose ID
 field is present in this list of IDs. The matching is done by exact string matching. If a file, the
 file name must end in ".list", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one ID per line.

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: Don't include non-variant sites
arguments.name: --exclude-non-variants

arguments.summary: List of sample expressions to exclude
arguments.name: --exclude-sample-expressions
arguments.fulltext:
Using a regular expression allows you to match multiple sample names that have that pattern in common. Note that
 sample exclusion takes precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be excluded. This
 argument can be specified multiple times in order to use multiple different matching patterns.

arguments.summary: Exclude genotypes from this sample
arguments.name: --exclude-sample-name
arguments.fulltext:
Note that sample exclusion takes precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be
 excluded. This argument can be specified multiple times in order to provide multiple sample names, or to
 specify the name of one or more files containing sample names. File names must use the extension ".args",
 and the expected file format is simply plain text with one sample name per line.

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: Allow for optimizations to improve the usability and performance for shared Posix Filesystems(e.g. NFS, Lustre). If set, file level locking is disabled and file system writes are minimized.
arguments.name: --genomicsdb-shared-posixfs-optimizations

arguments.summary: Use BCF Codec Streaming for data from GenomicsDB instead of the default VCFCodec. BCFCodec performs slightly better but currently does not support 64-bit width positions and INFO fields and for computed annotation sizes to exceed 32-bit integer space.
arguments.name: --genomicsdb-use-bcf-codec
arguments.fulltext:
Currently there is no support for 64-bit fields in BCF2Codec. The VCFCodec allows for 64-bit
 width positions and INFO fields and for computed annotation sizes to exceed the 32-bit
 integer space while encoding/decoding with GenomicsDB. Use the BCF2Codec option if and
 only if performance is an issue.

arguments.summary: Use the GCS HDFS Connector instead of the native GCS SDK client with gs:// URLs.
arguments.name: --genomicsdb-use-gcs-hdfs-connector

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: Output non-mendelian violation sites only
arguments.name: --invert-mendelian-violation
arguments.fulltext:
If this flag is enabled, this tool will select only variants that do not correspond to a mendelian violation as
 determined on the basis of family structure. Requires passing a pedigree file using the engine-level
 `-ped` argument.

arguments.summary: Invert the selection criteria for -select
arguments.name: --invertSelect
arguments.fulltext: Invert the selection criteria for -select.

arguments.summary: List of variant rsIDs to select
arguments.name: --keep-ids
arguments.fulltext:
List of IDs (or a .list file containing ids) to select. The tool will only select variants whose ID
 field is present in this list of IDs. The matching is done by exact string matching. If a file, the file
 name must end in ".list", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one ID per line.

arguments.summary: Store the original AC, AF, and AN values after subsetting
arguments.name: --keep-original-ac
arguments.fulltext:
When subsetting a callset, this tool recalculates the AC, AF, and AN values corresponding to the contents of the
 subset. If this flag is enabled, the original values of those annotations will be stored in new annotations called
 AC_Orig, AF_Orig, and AN_Orig.

arguments.summary: Store the original DP value after subsetting
arguments.name: --keep-original-dp
arguments.fulltext:
When subsetting a callset, this tool recalculates the site-level (INFO field) DP value corresponding to the
 contents of the subset. If this flag is enabled, the original value of the DP annotation will be stored in
 a new annotation called DP_Orig.

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: Maximum number of samples filtered at the genotype level
arguments.name: --max-filtered-genotypes
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, select sites where at most a maximum number of samples are filtered at the genotype level.

arguments.summary: Maximum fraction of samples filtered at the genotype level
arguments.name: --max-fraction-filtered-genotypes
arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is provided, select sites where a fraction or less of the samples are filtered at
 the genotype level.

arguments.summary: Maximum size of indels to include
arguments.name: --max-indel-size
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, indels that are larger than the specified size will be excluded.

arguments.summary: Maximum fraction of samples with no-call genotypes
arguments.name: --max-nocall-fraction
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, select sites where at most the given fraction of samples have no-call genotypes.

arguments.summary: Maximum number of samples with no-call genotypes
arguments.name: --max-nocall-number
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, select sites where at most the given number of samples have no-call genotypes.

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Output mendelian violation sites only
arguments.name: --mendelian-violation
arguments.fulltext:
If this flag is enabled, this tool will select only variants that correspond to a mendelian violation as
 determined on the basis of family structure. Requires passing a pedigree file using the engine-level
 `-ped` argument.

arguments.summary: Minimum GQ score for each trio member to accept a site as a violation
arguments.name: --mendelian-violation-qual-threshold
arguments.fulltext:
This argument specifies the genotype quality (GQ) threshold that all members of a trio must have in order
 for a site to be accepted as a mendelian violation. Note that the `-mv` flag must be set for this argument
 to have an effect.

arguments.summary: Minimum number of samples filtered at the genotype level
arguments.name: --min-filtered-genotypes
arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is provided, select sites where at least a minimum number of samples are filtered at
 the genotype level.

arguments.summary: Maximum fraction of samples filtered at the genotype level
arguments.name: --min-fraction-filtered-genotypes
arguments.fulltext:
If this argument is provided, select sites where a fraction or more of the samples are filtered at
 the genotype level.

arguments.summary: Minimum size of indels to include
arguments.name: --min-indel-size
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, indels that are smaller than the specified size will be excluded.

arguments.summary: Path to which variants should be written
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Pedigree file
arguments.name: --pedigree

arguments.summary: Preserve original alleles, do not trim
arguments.name: --preserve-alleles
arguments.fulltext:
The default behavior of this tool is to remove bases common to all remaining alleles after subsetting
 operations have been completed, leaving only their minimal representation. If this flag is enabled, the original
 alleles will be preserved as recorded in the input VCF.

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Select a fraction of genotypes at random from the input and sets them to no-call
arguments.name: --remove-fraction-genotypes
arguments.fulltext:
The value of this argument should be a number between 0 and 1 specifying the fraction of total variants to be
 randomly selected from the input callset and set to no-call (./). Note that this is done using a probabilistic
 function, so the final result is not guaranteed to carry the exact fraction requested. Can be used for large fractions.

arguments.summary: Remove alternate alleles not present in any genotypes
arguments.name: --remove-unused-alternates
arguments.fulltext:
When this flag is enabled, all alternate alleles that are not present in the (output) samples will be removed.
 Note that this even extends to biallelic SNPs - if the alternate allele is not present in any sample, it will be
 removed and the record will contain a '.' in the ALT column. Note also that sites-only VCFs, by definition, do
 not include the alternate allele in any genotype calls.

arguments.summary: Select only variants of a particular allelicity
arguments.name: --restrict-alleles-to
arguments.fulltext:
When this argument is used, we can choose to include only multiallelic or biallelic sites, depending on how many
 alleles are listed in the ALT column of a VCF. For example, a multiallelic record such as:
     1    100 .   A   AAA,AAAAA
 will be excluded if `-restrict-alleles-to BIALLELIC` is used, because there are two alternate alleles, whereas a
 record such as:
     1    100 .   A  T
 will be included in that case, but would be excluded if `-restrict-alleles-to MULTIALLELIC` is used.
 Valid options are ALL (default), MULTIALLELIC or BIALLELIC.

arguments.summary: Regular expression to select multiple samples
arguments.name: --sample-expressions
arguments.fulltext:
Using a regular expression allows you to match multiple sample names that have that pattern in common. This
 argument can be specified multiple times in order to use multiple different matching patterns.

arguments.summary: Include genotypes from this sample
arguments.name: --sample-name
arguments.fulltext:
This argument can be specified multiple times in order to provide multiple sample names, or to specify
 the name of one or more files containing sample names. File names must use the extension ".args", and the
 expected file format is simply plain text with one sample name per line. Note that sample exclusion takes
 precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be excluded.

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Select a fraction of variants at random from the input
arguments.name: --select-random-fraction
arguments.fulltext:
The value of this argument should be a number between 0 and 1 specifying the fraction of total variants to be
 randomly selected from the input callset. Note that this is done using a probabilistic function, so the final
 result is not guaranteed to carry the exact fraction requested. Can be used for large fractions.

arguments.summary: Do not select certain type of variants from the input file
arguments.name: --select-type-to-exclude
arguments.fulltext:
This argument excludes particular kinds of variants out of a list. If left empty, there is no type selection
 and all variant types are considered for other selection criteria. Valid types are INDEL, SNP, MIXED, MNP,
 SYMBOLIC, NO_VARIATION. Can be specified multiple times.

arguments.summary: Select only a certain type of variants from the input file
arguments.name: --select-type-to-include
arguments.fulltext:
This argument selects particular kinds of variants out of a list. If left empty, there is no type selection
 and all variant types are considered for other selection criteria. Valid types are INDEL, SNP, MIXED, MNP,
 SYMBOLIC, NO_VARIATION. Can be specified multiple times.

arguments.summary: One or more criteria to use when selecting the data
arguments.name: --selectExpressions
arguments.fulltext:
See example commands above for detailed usage examples. Note that these expressions are evaluated *after* the
 specified samples are extracted and the INFO field annotations are updated.

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: Set filtered genotypes to no-call
arguments.name: --set-filtered-gt-to-nocall
arguments.fulltext: If this argument is provided, set filtered genotypes to no-call (./.).

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: A VCF file containing variants
arguments.name: --variant

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Select a subset of variants from a VCF file

This tool makes it possible to select a subset of variants based on various criteria in order to facilitate certain analyses. Examples of such analyses include comparing and contrasting cases vs. controls, extracting variant or non-variant loci that meet certain requirements, or troubleshooting some unexpected results, to name a few.

There are many different options for selecting subsets of variants from a larger callset:

  • Extract one or more samples from a callset based on either a complete sample name or a pattern match.
  • Specify criteria for inclusion that place thresholds on annotation values, e.g. "DP > 1000" (depth of coverage greater than 1000x), "AF < 0.25" (sites with allele frequency less than 0.25). These criteria are written as "JEXL expressions", which are documented in the article about using JEXL expressions.
  • Provide concordance or discordance tracks in order to include or exclude variants that are also present in other given callsets.
  • Select variants based on criteria like their type (e.g. INDELs only), evidence of mendelian violation, filtering status, allelicity, etc.

There are also several options for recording the original values of certain annotations which are recalculated when one subsets the new callset, trims alleles, etc.

Input

A variant call set in VCF format from which a subset can be selected.

Output

A new VCF file containing the selected subset of variants.

*

Usage examples

Select SNPs

     gatk SelectVariants \
     -R Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta \
     -V input.vcf \
     --select-type-to-include SNP \
     -O output.vcf

Query Chromosome 20 Variants from a GenomicsDB

     gatk SelectVariants \
     -R Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta \
     -V gendb://genomicsDB \
     -L 20 \
     -O output.chr20.vcf
name: SelectVariants
